title: With the Decongestant SNAFU, the FDA Tries Something New
description: If the ineffective decongestant is removed from the market, other over-the-counter drugs could be up for reevaluation next.

title: How Mitt Romney Found His Own Footing—and Then the Door
description: After two awkward presidential bids, Romney became the rare GOP Senate unafraid of the wrath of Donald Trump's supporters.

title: Amber Heard Barely Appears in the New Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom Trailer. The Internet Has Thoughts
description: In the new trailer for the Aquaman sequel, Amber Heard's character appears only briefly. Social media users took notice.

title: G20 Nations Are Still Spending Billions of Dollars Supporting the Fossil-Fuel Industry
description: That's despite promising nearly 15 years ago to phase-out subsidies for the carbon-polluting industry.

title: Why Netflix’s German Thriller Dear Child Is the Show of the Moment
description: Netflix's new German thriller series unravels a dark web of secrets surrounding a mysterious woman's identity

title: Firefighters Fear the Toxic Chemicals in Their Gear Could Be Causing Cancer
description: Firefighters are starting to worry that the PFAS in their gear could be increasing their risk for cancer.

title: Making Steel Is Incredibly Polluting. This Company Wants to Change That
description: Boston Metal wants to upend centuries of steelmaking to fight climate change. CEO Tadeu Carneiro tells TIME how it's doing that.

title: How The Morning Show Rewrites the Notorious 2014 Sony Hack
description: In the second episode of the new season, UBA is attacked by cyber criminals in a very familiar setup.

title: There’s No Sign of Widespread COVID-19 Mandates. Republicans Are Warning of Them Anyway
description: GOP presidential candidates are warning about supposed widespread COVID-19 mandates and school closures that are not real.

title: Hunter Biden Indicted on Federal Firearms Charges
description: Hunter Biden is accused of lying about his drug use when he bought a firearm in October 2018, according to the indictment filed in federal court in Delaware.

title: Breaking Down Trump’s Four Indictments
description: TIME Senior Correspondent Brian Bennett explains all four of former President Donald Trump's criminal indictments.

title: An Auto Workers Strike Would Threaten Biden’s Green Coalition
description: A potential auto workers strike could imperil President Biden's reelection chances, and the future of his green policies.

title: NASA To Use Advanced Satellites and AI to Better Study UFOs
description: A NASA report calls for new scientific techniques to better study unidentified anomalous phenomena.

title: Watch Live: NASA Holds News Conference on Its UFO Study
description: NASA holds a news conference on the Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena (UAP) Independent Study Report. Watch it live.

title: India’s Modi to Keep Decades-Old Vow by Opening Controversial Temple
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is poised to open a Hindu temple in January where a centuries-old mosque once stood.

title: Where a Remote Employee Lives Shouldn’t Affect Their Pay
description: Remote work is here to stay and that means companies need to rethink how they pay employees

title: Myanmar Leader Aung Sang Suu Kyi’s Son Is Worried About Her Health in Detention
description: The younger son of Aung Sang Suu Kyi says he is increasingly worried about the imprisoned Myanmar leader's health.

title: Fran Drescher on What the SAG-AFTRA and WGA Strikes Mean for the Future of Labor
description: As the president of SAG-AFTRA, she's at the helm of one of the most significant labor events in Hollywood history

title: The Air Was Hot This Year, But It’s Nothing Compared to the Ocean
description: 'Our fate is intimately tied to the fate of our warming oceans,' write Stephen Porder and Baylor Fox-Kemper

title: Seoul to Host First Military Parade in a Decade as Tensions on Korean Peninsula Escalate
description: The last time the country staged such an event was in 2013. The renewed display of might coincides with escalating tensions on the Korean Peninsula.

title: AI Regulation Takes Baby Steps on Capitol Hill
description: In Washington, it has become much easier to agree on “existential risks” than specific constraints.

title: Iranian Women Are Still Fighting
description: One year after Mahsa Jina Amini died in the custody of the "morality police," Iranian women remain at the front of a simmering revolt

title: Subway Offers New 3-Inch Mini Sandwich in Economically Beleaguered Pakistan
description: The bite-size sandwich, which appeared on Pakistani menus and social media posts last month, provides “value” to Pakistani customers, said a spokesperson for Subway.

title: North Korea Says Putin May Visit Pyongyang After ‘Epoch-Making’ Talks With Kim in Russia
description: After the two leaders just held their first summit in four years, if Putin visits Pyongyang, it would be the first time he has met Kim in North Korea.

title: As Japan Struggles With Gender Equality, Record Number of Women Appointed to Cabinet
description: Five women feature in Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s new cabinet lineup, yet the influx may not exactly point to a gender equality breakthrough.
